Chances are it's failing.  CRON should be sending an email out about, though you probably don't have an alias set.  As root, if you have mailutils installed, you can type frm on the command line to see if root has mail.
If you don't want to install anything, you can just look at /var/spool/mail/ and see if root has a file.
cron jobs are run in the users home directory correct?
